main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky near Bloom, Kansas on August 3, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared suddenly and had an erratic course.
The object was observed both visually and on ground-based radar.
The report concluded that the object was 'Unidentified' and that there was 'Insufficient data for analysis'.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies and moderate winds.
